title: LAVID: An Agentic LVLM Framework for Diffusion-Generated Video Detection
author: Qingyuan Liu (Columbia University), Yun-Yun Tsai (Columbia University), Ruijian Zha (Columbia University), Victoria Li (Columbia University), Pengyuan Shi (Columbia University), Chengzhi Mao (Rutgers University), Junfeng Yang (Columbia University), ...
relevance_why: The proposed framework utilizes large vision-language models (LVLMs) for video detection, which could inform techniques for audio-visual synchronization and generative tasks in audio.
background: Detecting AI-generated videos by analyzing both visual and textual information combined with explicit knowledge tools to overcome limitations of traditional detection methods.
contribution: LAVID introduces a novel framework that enhances video detection using large vision-language models by leveraging explicit knowledge and structured prompts, achieving notable improvements in detection accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied on deep neural networks with supervised training that lacked generalization capabilities for unseen video artifacts.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work bypasses the need for extensive training by making use of LVLMs and an adaptive toolkit selection process.

key_innovation: The framework incorporates a self-rewriting structured prompt mechanism that adjusts based on real-time feedback, aiding in decision-making during detection tasks.
real_world_impact: This approach enhances digital media integrity by providing tools to detect and flag manipulated videos, thereby addressing issues of misinformation and digital privacy threats.
limitations: No explicit limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.LVLM: **Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs)** are AI models designed to integrate and understand both visual and textual data, empowering complex tasks across multiple modalities.
new_terms.explicit knowledge tools: **Explicit knowledge tools** refer to supplementary information extraction tools that enhance the detection capabilities of AI models by providing relevant features from the input data.
